get.summary: Returns metrics for a trading account
get.description: Returns a trading account metrics. This API call is billable. Requires access to metastats-api:rest:public:default:getMetrics method which is included into reader role. Requires access to account resource.

parameters.name: auth-token
parameters.description: MetaApi account access token or auth token

parameters.name: includeOpenPositions
parameters.description: indicates the inclusion of open positions in the calculation

200.description: metrics for a specified MetaTrader account returned successfully

metrics.description: metrics for the specific MetaTrader account

202.description: metrics for the specified MetaTrader account in processing

state.description: process state for the specified MetaTrader account

403.description: Authorization token has no access to metastats-api:rest:public:default:getMetrics method.

get.summary: Returns historical trades by time range for a trading account
get.description: Returns historical trades by range for a trading account. Updates the historical trades data and the API call will be counted towards billable MetaStats API calls by default. Not billed if updateHistory parameter is false. Requires access to metastats-api:rest:public:default:getTrades method which is included into reader role. Requires access to account resource.

parameters.name: auth-token
parameters.description: MetaApi account access token or auth token

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: start of time range, inclusive, in broker timezone, in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: end of time range, exclusive, in broker timezone, in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

parameters.name: updateHistory
parameters.description: update historical trades before returning results. If set to true,the API call will be counted towards billable MetaStats API calls. If set to false,the API call is not billable. Default is true

200.description: Historical trades with requested time range for a specifiedMetaTrader account returned successfully

trades.description: trades for the specific MetaTrader account

202.description: metrics for the specified MetaTrader account in processing

state.description: process state for the specified MetaTrader account

403.description: Authorization token has no access to metastats-api:rest:public:default:getTrades method.

404.description: MetaTrader account not found or not provisioned yet

get.summary: Returns open trades for a trading account
get.description: Returns open trades for a trading account. This API call is not billable. Requires access to metastats-api:rest:public:default:getOpenTrades method which is included into reader role. Requires access to account resource.

parameters.name: auth-token
parameters.description: MetaApi account access token or auth token

200.description: Open trades for a specified MetaTrader account returned successfully

openTrades.description: open trades for the specific MetaTrader account

403.description: Authorization token has no access to metastats-api:rest:public:default:getOpenTrades method.

404.description: MetaTrader account not found or not provisioned yet

get.summary: Returns a list of scheduled and recent tasks
Returns a list of registered UAT data sets
get.description: Returns a list of registered UAT data sets

post.summary: Applies a registered UAT data set with an id specified
post.description: Applies a registered UAT data set with an id specified

get.description: Returns redis traffic statistics. Requires access to express-microservice:rest:private:default:getRedisStatistics method.

parameters.name: auth-token
parameters.description: authorization token required if authorization is enabled

403.description: Authorization token has no access to express-microservice:rest:private:default:getRedisStatistics method.

inclusive.description: indicates whether open positions are included in the metrics, "false" means that there are no open positions. Only for a request with includeOpenPositions="true"

balance.description: [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp) - money on the account, not accounting for the results of currently [open positions](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/open-position.asp)

highestBalanceDate.description: date of maximum [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp) that have ever been on the account, in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

highestBalance.description: maximum [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp) that have ever been on the account

equity.description: [equity](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/equity.asp) is the result (current amount) of all [positions](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp), including [opened](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/open-position.asp)

trades.description: total number of [closed positions](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/closeposition.asp) on the account

bestTrade.description: the best [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that has ever been on the account

worstTrade.description: the worst [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that has ever been on the account

bestTradePips.description: the best [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that have ever been on the account

worstTradePips.description: the worst [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that have ever been on the account

bestTradeDate.description: date of the best [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that have ever been on the account, in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

bestTradePipsDate.description: date of the best [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that have ever been on the account, in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

worstTradeDate.description: date of the worst [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that have ever been on the account, in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

worstTradePipsDate.description: date of the worst [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) from one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that have ever been on the account, in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

commissions.description: [commissions](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/commission.asp) charged by the broker for the entire period

expectancy.description: the average [expected profitability](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/expectedreturn.asp) of one [trade](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) in basic currency

interest.description: cumulative [interest](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/i/interest.asp) and [swap](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/swap.asp) for the entire period

maxDrawdown.description: percentage of [maximum drawdown](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/maximum-drawdown-mdd.asp) of [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp)  during the entire trading history

profit.description: [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) is the total yield of [closed positions](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/closeposition.asp) for the entire period (total result)

absoluteGain.description: [absolute gain](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/absolutereturn.asp) is a simple [deposit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/deposit.asp) increase without regard to reinvestment

profitFactor.description: the amount yielded by winning [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) divided by the amount of losses yielded by losing ones [(read more)](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/fundamental-analysis/10/strategy-performance-reports.asp). Result in range 0 - Infinity means: `0` - only loss, `1` - profit equals to loss, `Infinity` - only profit.

sharpeRatio.description: [sharpe ratio](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sharperatio.asp) is the average return earned in excess of the risk-free rate per unit of volatility. It is calculated if there are at least 30 closed deals in the history

sortinoRatio.description: [sortino ratio](hhttps://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sortinoratio.asp) differentiates harmful volatility from total overall volatility. It is calculated if there are at least 30 closed deals in the history

standardDeviationProfit.description: a statistical measure of volatility shows how much variation or dispersion there is from the mean profit in basic currency [(read more)](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/standarddeviation.asp). It is calculated if there are at least 30 closed deals in the history

kurtosisProfit.description: profit [kurtosis](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/k/kurtosis.asp) is a statistical measure that is used to describe [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) distribution. It is calculated if there are at least 30 closed deals in the history

averageHoldingPeriodReturn.description: average [holding period return](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/h/holdingperiodreturn-yield.asp). It is calculated if there are at least 30 closed deals in the history

zScore.description: [zScore](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/fundamental/04/021104.asp) - the ability of a trading system to generate [wins and losses](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) in streaks. It is calculated if there are at least 30 closed deals in the history

probability.description: [probability](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Error_function) that a [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) will be followed by a profit and a [loss](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) by a loss

daysSinceTradingStarted.description: the number of days that have passed since the opening of the first trade

currencySummary.description: [currency trading](https://www.investopedia.com/financial-edge/0412/the-basics-of-currency-trading.aspx) summary provides statistics on winning and losing trades indicating the amount in the context of long and short positions. Statistics is given for all currency pairs, for which positions were opened.

dailyGrowth.description: daily [growth](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/g/growthrates.asp) shows the profitability of the trading account. It shows each profit received from the volume of trade and changes in balance, total accumulated income and existing account drawdown [by day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day)

periods.description: there are trading stats for today, this week, this month, this year compared to the results for the previous period

tradeDurationDiagram.description: list of information columns about the [duration](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/term.asp) of [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) for the diagram

totalTradeMarketValue.description: Total market value of all trades on the account

history.description: profit from trading a currency pair on long and short positions in [one trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day)

total.description: General data (such as profit, number of trades) about trading a specific currency pair

short.description: profit and number of trades of [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) in a specific currency

long.description: profit and number of trades of [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) in a specific currency

date.description: date of [trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day), in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD format

totalProfit.description: the value of the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) at the end of the day

totalPips.description: the value of the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) at the end of the day

wonTrades.description: the number of [winning trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) with this currency

lostTrades.description: the number of [losing trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) with this currency

trades.description: the number of all [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/closeposition.asp) with this currency
the number of all [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/closeposition.asp) with this currency

probabilityOfLoss.description: [probability of loss](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/risk-of-ruin.asp) shows the risk of losing a particular part of the [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp)

consecutiveLosingTrades.description: the number of [losing trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) that must be entered sequentially in order for this part of the [balance](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/accountbalance.asp) to be lost

date.description: date of [trading day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day), in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD format

drawdownProfit.description: maximum registered [balance drawdown](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/drawdown.asp) in basic currency during this [day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trading_day)

gain.description: percentage gain ([rate of return](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/rateofreturn.asp)) of this period

trades.description: the number of [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) of this period

profitDifference.description: difference in [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) with the previous period

pipsDifference.description: difference in [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) with the previous period

lotsDifference.description: difference in [lots](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/standard-lot.asp) with the previous period

gainDifference.description: difference in [percentage gain](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/rateofreturn.asp) with the previous period

tradesDifference.description: difference in the number of [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) with the previous period

wonTradesPercentDifference.description: difference in [percentage of winning trades](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/fundamental-analysis/10/strategy-performance-reports.asp) with the previous period

date.description: date of trading month, in broker timezone, YYYY-MM format

trades.description: the number of [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) of this month

rewardToRiskRatio.description: [reward to risk ratio](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/riskrewardratio.asp) - the difference between reward and risk, where the lesser is always one. So 0 means reward:risk=1:1, 2 means 3:1, -0.5 means 1:1.5

popularityPercent.description: the percentage of [popularity](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/forex/11/popular-currencies-and-why-theyre-traded.asp) of this currency this month

durations.description: the number of [durations](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/term.asp) in this column

trades.description: the number of [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) in this column

minDurationInSeconds.description: minimum trade [duration](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/term.asp) in this column in seconds

maxDurationInSeconds.description: maximum trade [duration](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/term.asp) in this column in seconds

won.description: collection of metrics of winning [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) in this column

lost.description: collection of metrics of losing [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) in this column

profit.description: the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of the [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/open-position.asp) at this time

shortProfit.description: the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) at this time

longProfit.description: the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) at this time

wonProfit.description: the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of [winning trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

lostProfit.description: the total [profit](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/profit.asp) of [losing trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

pips.description: the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

shortPips.description: the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) at this time

longPips.description: the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) at this time

wonPips.description: the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [winning trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

lostPips.description: the total [pips](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp) of [losing trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

trades.description: the number of all [trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/o/open-position.asp) at this time

shortTrades.description: the number of [short trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp) at this time

longTrades.description: the number of [long trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) at this time

wonTrades.description: the number of [winning trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

lostTrades.description: the number of [losing trades](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/position.asp) at this time

hour.description: day hour (only for by hour case)

day.description: weekday number (only for by day case)

openTime.description: time the trade was opened at in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

closeTime.description: time the trade was closed at in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

pips.description: the number of pips ([price units](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp)) earned (positive)or lost (negative) in this trade

openTime.description: time the trade was opened at in broker timezone, YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss.SSS format

pips.description: the number of pips ([price units](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/p/pip.asp)) earned (positive)or lost (negative) in this trade

arguments.description: Error message arguments, used for i18n

requestsPerPeriodAllowed.description: allowed number of requests per period
